results.title: Vigil on wheels
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Films Division, Government of India and V.R. Sarma
results.brief_description: Portrays the job done by railway men in providing safety for passengers who speed across India day and night. Shows the maintenance of locomotives and carriages, and the frequent checking to which they are subject to ensure proper functioning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Films Division, Government of India and V.R. Sarma

results.title: Vigil
results.creator_credit: John Maynard, John Maynard Productions and Vincent Ward
results.brief_description: A family’s bitter struggle to eke out a living in the harsh environment of a high mountain valley has eroded the parent’s marriage. After the tragic death of her father, twelve-year-old Toss, in empathy with her grandfather’s dreams, compensates for a life of isolation by inventing imaginary worlds. The fragments of reality she perceives are put together according to her own logic. When an itinerant hunter begins work on the farm and is befriended by her mother and grandfather, Toss’s reality is thrown further into crisis. The landscape is centrally implicated in a world of nightmares and dreams. Cast includes Penelope Stewart, Frank Whitten, Bill Kerr and Fiona Kay.

results.title: Views on trial
results.creator_credit: Ralph May, Anvil Films and Richard Warren
results.brief_description: Deals with the objections sometimes raised against measures aimed at increasing productivity in a novel way in the form of a trial. The defendant, representing the indifferent worker who is opposed to better work methods is put up against various witnesses who are called to explode his views. The judge sums up the case, and the jury, the audience, must consider the verdict. The attitude to better work methods must be positive and helpful. Our standard of living depends upon our efforts to produce more. We must work better, but not necessarily harder, if we are to maintain and improve our standard of living.

results.title: Viewpoint on Perth
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia, Curtis Levy and Brian Woods
results.brief_description: The city of Perth, Western Australia, as seen through the eyes of European migrants. Commentary is made on the life style in Perth including housing, public transport, shopping facilities, job availability, industries, education and the role of the mining industry in Western Australia.

results.title: View of Middleharnis
results.creator_credit: Sir Arthur Hallam Elton, Multifilm Studios, Shell Film Unit and Charles Van der Linden
results.brief_description: The great winter storm of 1953 breached many dykes in the south-west Netherlands, flooding vast areas of fertile land. This film shows how 25 kms of dykes at Goeree-Overflakkee were repaired during the summer of 1953, in time to protect the land against the spring tides and storms of the coming winter. Great quantities of bitumen were used in this repair work.

results.title: View of America from the 23rd century
results.creator_credit: Beryl Fox and National Educational Television
results.brief_description: A consideration of the need for institutions to have the ability to change, and reformers to use reason. John W. Gardner, former Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, dramatises how present American institutions might look when viewed from the 23rd Century. Shows the human population increasingly raging against institutions because most have been designed to resist rather than facilitate change.

results.title: View from the typewriter
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Duncan and George Johnson
results.brief_description: A compilation of excerpts from National Film Board of Canada documentaries that deal with Canadian writers and their sense of place. Featuring readings from the works of Hugh MacLennan, W.O. Mitchell, Jack Hodges, Farley Mowat, Margaret Laurence, Earle Birney, Malcolm Lowry, Leonard Cohen, Margaret Atwood and Milton Acorn, the documentary examines how Canadian writers have attempted to make sense of a landscape and a geography that traverses huge differences of scale, topography and climate. The readings are powerful, including Richard Burton reading from Lowry’s work, and though specific to the Canadian experience, the film is also relevant to Australian writing about extremes of location. Just like English speaking Canadians, our writing too grapples with making sense of a country and terrain which encompasses the duality of being both “new” and ancient.

results.title: View from the people wall
results.creator_credit: IBM, Charles Eames and Ray Eames
results.brief_description: A statement about problem solving and abstract models taken from the show in the ‘Information Machine IBM Pavilion’ New York World’s Fair. Though not showing all 22 screens of the Think presentation, the 9 screens included in this film still convey much of the visual richness of the presentation in an effort to help general audiences see problem solving on a large scale (such as urban planning) as being closely related to problem solving on a personal level. This single screen version is a marvellous synthesis of the imagery. Shows that both simple and complex problems are solved in the same manner and traces the steps in the problem solving process. Conveys them importance of abstract models in problem solving and demonstrates various types of models. Also shows the role of the computer in solving complex problems and emphasises how the simplification of a problem may aid in defining its essential nature. Follows five steps: 1. Stating the problem; 2. Collecting information; 3. Abstracting the information; 4. Building the model; 5. Manipulating the model. Story by Glen Fleck, music by Elmer Bernstein, hosted by Roger Sargent.

results.title: View from the edge
results.creator_credit: David Cheshire, David Richardson, BBC and RM Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Shock of the New Series”.
Part 6 of an 8-part series presented by art critic and writer, Robert Hughes. In this episode the strand of 20th century art - expressionism and abstract expressionism, which deals with the dark extremities of human emotion are explored. The work of such painters as Van Gogh, Munch and Rothko are examined.
